result.execSummary:
The defendant Katherine M Minturn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Continue with current counseling.  Submit to an AODA assessmenta and follow through with any treatment, counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety.

No contact with victim.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katherine M Minturn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Katherine M Minturn in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 3 days if revoked.
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $343.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Continue with current counseling.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UA's.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Maintain full-time employment.  No contact with victim.  

 Count 2:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 3 days if revoked.
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Katherine M Minturn in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Katherine M Minturn in court with attorney Jeffrey Szczewski for Anthony Cotton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are working on a resolution and request a further proceedings date.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Katherine M Minturn in court with attorney Anthony Cotton.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Cotton requests witnesses to be sequestered.  Witnesses sequestered.  Waukesha County Sheriff's Deputy Nicholas Ollinger sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Nickolie.  Cross examination by Attorney Cotton.  Waukesha County Sheriff's Deputy Matthew Trumbo sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Nickolie.  Cross examination by Attorney Cotton.  Waukesha County Sheriff's Deputy Amy Lonzrick sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Nickolie.  Cross examination by Attorney Cotton.  Waukesha County Sheriff's Deputy Michael Pavlovich sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Nickolie.  Cross examination by Attorney Cotton.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Defense objects and moves for dismissal.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Preliminary hearing on March 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed..  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant Katherine M Minturn in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
